tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: have taken their idols into their hearts
tn.text: AT: "consider their idols to be very important" or "have affection for their idols"

tn.ref: before their own faces
tn.text: God is saying the men have placed the idols where they can see them. This shows the idols are important to them. AT: "where it can be seen"

tn.ref: stumbling block of their iniquity
tn.text: The idols are referred to as something their sin causes them to trip and fall over. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Should I be inquired of at all by them?
tn.text: AT: "They should not ask me for anything." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Therefore announce this to them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to the "men from the elders of Israel"

tn.ref: who takes his idols into his heart
tn.text: AT: "who considers his idols to be very important" or "who has affection for his idols"

tn.ref: the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face
tn.text: The words "before his face" mean "with his full attention." AT: "the idol that he has used to sin by worshiping it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: then comes to a prophet
tn.text: A person goes to a prophet in order to hear what God has to say. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the number of his idols
tn.text: AT: "how many idols he has."

tn.ref: I may take back the house of Israel in their hearts
tn.text: AT: "I will make the people of Israel love me again"

tn.ref: take back ... driven far from me
tn.text: He says he will bring them back in order to make them love Him even though their idols have pushed them away from God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the house of Israel
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]].

tn.ref: Repent and turn away from your idols! Turn back your faces from all your abominations
tn.text: Both of these phrases are ways to tell the people of Israel to stop worshiping idols. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Repent and turn away
tn.text: The words "Repent" and "turn way" mean basically the same thing. Together they strengthen the command to stop worshiping idols. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: who takes his idols into his heart
tn.text: AT: "who considers his idols to be very important" or "who has affection for his idols"

tn.ref: and puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his own face
tn.text: AT: "the idol that he has used to sin by worshiping it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will set my face against that man
tn.text: AT: "I will be against him" or "I will give my attention to being against him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: make him a sign and a proverb
tn.text: Here the words "sign" and "proverb" refer to something that serves as a warning to others about the bad consequences of wicked behavior. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will reach out with my hand against him
tn.text: God's hand refers to what he does. AT: "I will work against him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: They will carry their own iniquity
tn.text: AT: They will be responsible for what they have done wrong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: will no longer wander away from following me
tn.text: The phrase "wander away from following me" compares not doing what God wants to walking away from him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: these same three men
tn.text: Noah, Daniel, and Job

tn.ref: as I live, declares the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: This can be reordered: "the Lord Yahweh declares. "as I live"

tn.ref: only their own lives would be rescued
tn.text: "Yahweh would only rescue their lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: these three men
tn.text: Noah, Daniel, and Job

tn.ref: as I live, declares the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: This can be reordered: "the Lord Yahweh declares. "as I live"

tn.ref: pour out my fury
tn.text: Like a jar holds water, God had been holding back judgment. So "pour out my fury" means God will no longer hold back from acting on his anger but will act on his anger against the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: cut off both man and beast
tn.text: This phrase refers to being killed as an act of divine judgment for sin. AT: "kill both man and beast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: from her
tn.text: The word "her" refers to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to speak with Ezekiel about the punishment of the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Behold!
tn.text: The word "Behold!" here alerts us to pay attention to the information that follows.

tn.ref: left in her ... done against her
tn.text: The word "her" refers to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: their ways and their actions
tn.text: Both of these phrases refer to what the people of Israel have done. AT: "the way they live" or "the things they do." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
